title: Adam Smith & Foundations of Political Economy
description: Adam Smith's two great works synthesizing moral philosophy with political economy, plus foundational influences: Hartley's vibration theory of association and Quesnay's Physiocratic natural order.
keyIdeas: Sympathy as basis of moral judgment
intellectualContext: Smith synthesizes Hutcheson's moral philosophy with economic analysis, reconciling Mandeville's self-interest paradox with benevolence through sympathy and market mechanisms.
researchValue: The hinge between moral philosophy and political economy. Essential for understanding classical economics and the philosophical foundations of free market theory.
